body:
Added support for multi colored bars in bargraphs (fillStyle and strokeStyle).

`fillColor` and `strokeColor` in the `datasets` definition can now be arrays of colors. Each bar in the bar graph should then cycle through these colours.

Here's the modifed example from bar.html and what it looks like:
```javscript
fillColor : ["rgba(220,220,220,0.5)", "rgba(235,136,0,0.5)"],
strokeColor : ["rgba(220,220,220,1)", "rgba(235,136,0, 1)"],
````

![image](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/547147/643683/51d948c2-d37b-11e2-872e-6029573aad24.png)
title: Support for multi colored bars in bar graphs

body:
It looks like when animation is disabled, the behavior can get quite glitchy in Firefox. Works in Chrome, though.

I've set up a [demo application](https://github.com/bebraw/cdnperf/tree/ff-issue) illustrating the issue. It uses a slightly modified version of Chart.js (uses tooltip additions) but I can confirm the issue in a vanilla version too.

On a related note if animation steps option is set too small (2, 3), it doesn't end up in the right chart position on Firefox. I'll open up a separate issue for that.
title: When animation is disabled, might not render in Firefox
